meanings.def: a thing or an idea that has been invented
examples: Fax machines were a wonderful invention at the time.
He failed to patent his invention and never made a penny from it.
The two friends started a company to market their invention.
This combination of cheese and apples is not an invention of the north of England.
Such changes have not been seen since the invention of the printing press.
After the war, Westinghouse devoted himself to invention.

meanings.def: the act of inventing a story or an idea and pretending that it is true; a story invented in this way
examples: This story is apparently a complete invention.
Most of what she says is pure invention.
What would he tell his parents? Some invention and quick thinking—that’s what was needed.

meanings.def: the ability to have new and interesting ideas
examples: John was full of invention—always making up new dance steps and sequences.
Her powers of invention were somewhat limited.

meanings.def: a difficult new problem forces people to think of a solution to it

idioms.idiom: necessity is the mother of invention
idioms.def: a difficult new problem forces people to think of a solution to it
